linear_equations.name: Linear Equations
linear_equations.content:
Linear Equations

An equation that makes a straight line when graphed. It has the form: ax + b = 0 where a ≠ 0.

Key Points:
  • Standard form: ax + b = 0
  • Solution: x = -b/a
  • Can have one solution, no solution, or infinite solutions
  • Graph is always a straight line
Example:

Solve 2x + 4 = 0
2x = -4
x = -2

Practice Problems:
  1. 3x + 9 = 0
  2. 5x - 15 = 0
  3. 2x + 7 = 3x - 2

quadratic_equations.name: Quadratic Equations
quadratic_equations.content:
Quadratic Equations

An equation of the form ax² + bx + c = 0 where a ≠ 0.

Key Points:
  • Standard form: ax² + bx + c = 0
  • Solutions found using quadratic formula: x = [-b ± √(b² - 4ac)]/2a
  • Discriminant (b² - 4ac) determines nature of roots
  • Graph is a parabola
Example:

Solve x² - 5x + 6 = 0
(x - 2)(x - 3) = 0
x = 2 or x = 3

Discriminant Rules:
  • If b² - 4ac > 0: Two real roots
  • If b² - 4ac = 0: One real root (repeated)
  • If b² - 4ac < 0: No real roots (complex)

inequalities.name: Inequalities
inequalities.content:
Inequalities

Mathematical expressions involving <, >, ≤, or ≥.

Key Rules:
  • Adding/subtracting same number preserves inequality
  • Multiplying/dividing by negative number FLIPS the inequality
Examples:

Solve 2x + 3 > 7
2x > 4
x > 2

Solve -3x < 12
x > -4 (flipped when dividing by -3)

polynomials.name: Polynomials
polynomials.content:
Polynomials

Expressions with variables and coefficients using operations +, -, ×.

Key Terms:
  • Degree: Highest power of variable
  • Coefficient: Number multiplied by variable
  • Constant term: Term with no variable
Operations:

Addition: (2x² + 3x) + (4x² - 2x) = 6x² + x

Multiplication: (x + 2)(x + 3) = x² + 5x + 6

limits.name: Limits
limits.content:
Limits

The value that a function approaches as the input approaches some value.

Key Points:
  • Notation: lim(x→a) f(x) = L
  • Left-hand limit and right-hand limit must be equal
  • Used to define continuity and derivatives
Common Limits:
  • lim(x→0) sin x / x = 1
  • lim(x→∞) 1/x = 0

derivatives.name: Derivatives
derivatives.content:
Derivatives

Measures the rate of change of a function.

Key Rules:
  • Power Rule: d/dx(xⁿ) = nxⁿ⁻¹
  • Constant Rule: d/dx(c) = 0
  • Sum Rule: d/dx(f + g) = f' + g'
Examples:

d/dx(x³) = 3x²

d/dx(5x²) = 10x

integration.name: Integration
integration.content:
Integration

The reverse process of differentiation.

Key Rules:
  • Power Rule: ∫xⁿ dx = xⁿ⁺¹/(n+1) + C, n ≠ -1
  • ∫1/x dx = ln|x| + C
  • ∫eˣ dx = eˣ + C
Definite Integrals:

∫ₐᵇ f(x) dx = F(b) - F(a), where F is antiderivative

basic_ratios.name: Basic Trigonometric Ratios
basic_ratios.content:
Trigonometric Ratios

Relations between angles and sides of right triangles.

Definitions:
  • sin θ = opposite/hypotenuse
  • cos θ = adjacent/hypotenuse
  • tan θ = opposite/adjacent
Reciprocal Ratios:
  • csc θ = 1/sin θ
  • sec θ = 1/cos θ
  • cot θ = 1/tan θ

identities.name: Trigonometric Identities
identities.content:
Important Identities

Pythagorean Identities:
  • sin²θ + cos²θ = 1
  • 1 + tan²θ = sec²θ
  • 1 + cot²θ = csc²θ
Double Angle:
  • sin 2θ = 2 sin θ cos θ
  • cos 2θ = cos²θ - sin²θ
